010package imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
013import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
014import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
015import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
016
017/**
018 * This class represents an arbitrary linear transformation in 2D.
019 * Instances of this class and any subclass are immutable.
020 */
021public class LinearMapping2D implements Mapping2D {
022        
023        protected final double 
024                a00, a01, a02,
025                a10, a11, a12,
026                a20, a21, a22;
027
028        //  constructors -----------------------------------------------------
029        
030        /**
031         * Creates a new identity mapping.
032         */
033        public LinearMapping2D() {
034                a00 = 1; a01 = 0; a02 = 0;
035                a10 = 0; a11 = 1; a12 = 0;
036                a20 = 0; a21 = 0; a22 = 1;
037        }
038        
039        /**
040         * Creates a linear mapping from a transformation matrix A.
041         * @param A a (3,3) or (2,3) matrix
042         */
043        public LinearMapping2D(double[][] A) {
044                a00 = A[0][0]; a01 = A[0][1]; a02 = A[0][2];
045                a10 = A[1][0]; a11 = A[1][1]; a12 = A[1][2];
046                if (A.length == 3) {
047                        a20 = A[2][0]; a21 = A[2][1]; a22 = A[2][2];
048                }
049                else {
050                        a20 = 0; a21 = 0; a22 = 1;
051                }
052        }
053
054        /**
055         * Creates an arbitrary linear mapping from the specified matrix elements.
056         * @param a00 matrix element A_00
057         * @param a01 matrix element A_01
058         * @param a02 matrix element A_02
059         * @param a10 matrix element A_10
060         * @param a11 matrix element A_11
061         * @param a12 matrix element A_12
062         * @param a20 matrix element A_20
063         * @param a21 matrix element A_21
064         * @param a22 matrix element A_22
065         */
066        public LinearMapping2D (
067                        double a00, double a01, double a02, 
068                        double a10, double a11, double a12,
069                        double a20, double a21, double a22) {
070                this.a00 = a00;  this.a01 = a01;  this.a02 = a02;
071                this.a10 = a10;  this.a11 = a11;  this.a12 = a12;
072                this.a20 = a20;  this.a21 = a21;  this.a22 = a22;
073        }
074        
075        /**
076         * Creates a new linear mapping from an existing linear mapping.
077         * @param lm a given linear mapping
078         */
079        public LinearMapping2D (LinearMapping2D lm) {
080                this(lm.getTransformationMatrix());
081        }
082        
083        // ----------------------------------------------------------
084        
085        /**
086         * Scales the transformation matrix such that a22 becomes 1.
087         * Any linear mapping can be normalized and thereby be converted to
088         * a projective mapping (see {@link ProjectiveMapping2D}.
089         * @return the normalized linear mapping (i.e., a projective mapping)
090         */
091        public ProjectiveMapping2D normalize() {
092                if (Arithmetic.isZero(Math.abs(a22))) {
093                        throw new ArithmeticException("Zero value in a22, cannot normalize linear mapping!");
094                }
095                double b00 = a00/a22;   double b01 = a01/a22;   double b02 = a02/a22;
096                double b10 = a10/a22;   double b11 = a11/a22;   double b12 = a12/a22;
097                double b20 = a20/a22;   double b21 = a21/a22;
098                return new ProjectiveMapping2D(b00, b01, b02, b10, b11, b12, b20, b21);
099        }
100        
101        // ----------------------------------------------------------
102        
103        @Override
104        public Point applyTo(Point pnt) {
105                final double x = pnt.getX();
106                final double y = pnt.getY();
107                double h =  (a20 * x + a21 * y + a22);
108                double x1 = (a00 * x + a01 * y + a02) / h;
109                double y1 = (a10 * x + a11 * y + a12) / h;
110                return Point.create(x1, y1);
111        }
112        
113//      @Override
114//      public double[] applyTo (double x, double y) {
115//              double h =  (a20 * x + a21 * y + a22);
116//              double x1 = (a00 * x + a01 * y + a02) / h;
117//              double y1 = (a10 * x + a11 * y + a12) / h;
118//              return new double[] {x1, y1};
119//      }
120        
121        /**
122         * Calculates and returns the inverse mapping.
123         */
124        public LinearMapping2D getInverse() {
125                // System.out.println("LinearMapping getInverse()");
126                double[][] ai = Matrix.inverse(this.getTransformationMatrix());
127                return new LinearMapping2D(ai);
128        }
129        
130        /**
131         * Concatenates this mapping A with another linear mapping B and returns
132         * a new mapping C, such that C(x) = B(A(x)).
133         * @param B the second mapping
134         * @return the concatenated mapping
135         */
136        public LinearMapping2D concat(LinearMapping2D B) {
137                double[][] C = Matrix.multiply(B.getTransformationMatrix(), this.getTransformationMatrix());
138                return new LinearMapping2D(C);
139        }
140        
141        /**
142         * Concatenates a sequence of linear mappings AA = (A1, A2, ..., An), with
143         * the result A(x) = A1(A2(...(An(x))...)). Thus, the mapping
144         * An is applied first and A1 last, with the associated transformation
145         * matrix a = a1 * a2 * ... * an.
146         * If AA is empty, the identity mapping is returned.
147         * If AA contains only a single mapping, a copy of this mapping is returned.
148         * 
149         * @param AA a (possibly empty) sequence of linear transformations
150         * @return the concatenated linear transformation 
151         */
152        public static LinearMapping2D concatenate(LinearMapping2D... AA) {
153                if (AA.length == 0) {
154                        return new LinearMapping2D();   // identity
155                }
156                else {
157                        double[][] a = AA[0].getTransformationMatrix();
158                        for (int i = 1; i < AA.length; i++) {
159                                a = Matrix.multiply(a, AA[i].getTransformationMatrix());
160                        }
161                        return new LinearMapping2D(a);
162                }
163        }
164        
165        /**
166         * Retrieves the transformation matrix for this mapping.
167         * @return the 3x3 transformation matrix
168         */
169        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
170                return new double[][]
171                                {{a00, a01, a02},
172                                 {a10, a11, a12},
173                                 {a20, a21, a22}};
174        }
175
176        /**
177         * Returns a copy of this mapping.
178         * @return a new mapping of the same type
179         */
180        public LinearMapping2D duplicate() {
181                return new LinearMapping2D(this);
182        }
183
184        public String toString() {
185                return Matrix.toString(getTransformationMatrix());
186        }
187        
188        // -----------------------------------------------------------
189        
190//      /**
191//       * For testing only.
192//       * @param args ignored
193//       */
194//      public static void main(String[] args) {
195//              PrintPrecision.set(6);
196//              double[][] A = 
197//                              {{-1.230769, 2.076923, -1.769231}, 
198//                              {-2.461538, 2.615385, -3.538462}, 
199//                              {-0.307692, 0.230769, 1.000000}};
200//              System.out.println("A = " + Matrix.toString(A));
201//              
202//              double[][] Ai = Matrix.inverse(A);
203//              System.out.println("Ai = " + Matrix.toString(Ai));
204//              
205//              double[][] I = Matrix.multiply(A, Ai);
206//              System.out.println("\ntest: should be the  identity matrix: = \n" + Matrix.toString(I));
207//              
208//              ProjectiveMapping pA = (new LinearMapping2D(A)).normalize();
209//              System.out.println("mapping pA = \n" + pA.toString());
210//              
211//              ProjectiveMapping AA1 = pA.concat(pA);
212//              System.out.println("mapping AA1 = \n" + AA1.toString());
213//              
214//              ProjectiveMapping AA2 = LinearMapping2D.concatenate(pA, pA).normalize();
215//              System.out.println("mapping AA1 = \n" + AA2.toString());
216//      }
217
218
219        
220}
221
